segment.source: How to Recover Remote Computers by Using the DaRT Recovery Image
segment.target: How to Recover Remote Computers by Using the DaRT Recovery Image

segment.source: How to Recover Remote Computers by Using the DaRT Recovery Image
segment.target: How to Recover Remote Computers by Using the DaRT Recovery Image

segment.source: How to Recover Remote Computers by Using the DaRT Recovery Image
segment.target: How to Recover Remote Computers by Using the DaRT Recovery Image

segment.source: Use the Remote Connection feature in Microsoft Diagnostics and Recovery Toolset (DaRT) 8.0 to run the DaRT tools remotely on an end-user computer.
segment.target: Use the Remote Connection feature in Microsoft Diagnostics and Recovery Toolset (DaRT) 8.0 to run the DaRT tools remotely on an end-user computer.

segment.source: After the end user provides the administrator or help desk worker with certain information, the IT administrator or help desk worker can take control of the end user's computer and run the necessary DaRT tools remotely.
segment.target: After the end user provides the administrator or help desk worker with certain information, the IT administrator or help desk worker can take control of the end user's computer and run the necessary DaRT tools remotely.

segment.source: If you disabled the DaRT tools when you created the recovery image, you still have access to all of the tools.
segment.target: If you disabled the DaRT tools when you created the recovery image, you still have access to all of the tools.

segment.source: All of the tools, except Remote Connection, are unavailable to end users.
segment.target: All of the tools, except Remote Connection, are unavailable to end users.

segment.source: To recover a remote computer by using the DaRT recovery image
segment.target: To recover a remote computer by using the DaRT recovery image

segment.source: Boot an end-user computer by using the DaRT recovery image.
segment.target: Boot an end-user computer by using the DaRT recovery image.

segment.source: You will typically use one of the following methods to boot into DaRT to recover a remote computer, depending on how you deploy the DaRT recovery image.
segment.target: You will typically use one of the following methods to boot into DaRT to recover a remote computer, depending on how you deploy the DaRT recovery image.

segment.source: For more information about deploying the DaRT recovery image, see Deploying DaRT 8.0.
segment.target: For more information about deploying the DaRT recovery image, see Deploying DaRT 8.0.

segment.source: Boot into DaRT from a recovery partition on the problem computer.
segment.target: Boot into DaRT from a recovery partition on the problem computer.

segment.source: Boot into DaRT from a remote partition on the network.
segment.target: Boot into DaRT from a remote partition on the network.

segment.source: For information about the advantages and disadvantages of each method, see Planning How to Save and Deploy the DaRT 8.0 Recovery Image.
segment.target: For information about the advantages and disadvantages of each method, see Planning How to Save and Deploy the DaRT 8.0 Recovery Image.

segment.source: Whichever method that you use to boot into DaRT, you must enable the boot device in the BIOS for the boot option or options that you want to make available to the end user.
segment.target: Whichever method that you use to boot into DaRT, you must enable the boot device in the BIOS for the boot option or options that you want to make available to the end user.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: Configuring the BIOS is unique, depending on the kind of hard disk drive, network adapters, and other hardware that is used in your organization.
segment.target: Configuring the BIOS is unique, depending on the kind of hard disk drive, network adapters, and other hardware that is used in your organization.

segment.source: As the computer is booting into the DaRT recovery image, the NetStart dialog box appears.
segment.target: As the computer is booting into the DaRT recovery image, the NetStart dialog box appears.

segment.source: When you are asked whether you want to initialize network services, select one of the following:
segment.target: When you are asked whether you want to initialize network services, select one of the following:

segment.source: Yes - it is assumed that a DHCP server is present on the network, and an attempt is made to obtain an IP address from the server.
segment.target: Yes - it is assumed that a DHCP server is present on the network, and an attempt is made to obtain an IP address from the server.

segment.source: If the network uses static IP addresses instead of DHCP, you can later use the TCP/IP Configuration tool in DaRT to specify a static IP address.
segment.target: If the network uses static IP addresses instead of DHCP, you can later use the TCP/IP Configuration tool in DaRT to specify a static IP address.

segment.source: No - skip the network initialization process.
segment.target: No - skip the network initialization process.

segment.source: Indicate whether you want to remap the drive letters.
segment.target: Indicate whether you want to remap the drive letters.

segment.source: When you run Windows online, the system volume is typically mapped to drive C. However, when you run Windows offline under WinRE, the original system volume might be mapped to another drive, and this can cause confusion.
segment.target: When you run Windows online, the system volume is typically mapped to drive C. However, when you run Windows offline under WinRE, the original system volume might be mapped to another drive, and this can cause confusion.

segment.source: If you decide to remap, DaRT tries to map the offline drive letters to match the online drive letters.
segment.target: If you decide to remap, DaRT tries to map the offline drive letters to match the online drive letters.

segment.source: Remapping is performed only if an offline operating system is selected later in the startup process.
segment.target: Remapping is performed only if an offline operating system is selected later in the startup process.

segment.source: On the System Recovery Options dialog box, select a keyboard layout.
segment.target: On the System Recovery Options dialog box, select a keyboard layout.

segment.source: Check the displayed system root directory, the kind of operating system installed, and the partition size.
segment.target: Check the displayed system root directory, the kind of operating system installed, and the partition size.

segment.source: If you do not see your operating system listed, and suspect that the lack of drivers is a possible cause of the failure, click Load Drivers to load the suspect drivers, and then insert the installation media for the device and select the driver.
segment.target: If you do not see your operating system listed, and suspect that the lack of drivers is a possible cause of the failure, click Load Drivers to load the suspect drivers, and then insert the installation media for the device and select the driver.

segment.source: Select the installation that you want to repair or diagnose, and then click Next.
segment.target: Select the installation that you want to repair or diagnose, and then click Next.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: If the Windows Recovery Environment (WinRE) detects or suspects that Windows 8 did not start correctly the last time that it was tried, Startup Repair might start to run automatically.
segment.target: If the Windows Recovery Environment (WinRE) detects or suspects that Windows 8 did not start correctly the last time that it was tried, Startup Repair might start to run automatically.

segment.source: For information about how to resolve this issue, see Troubleshooting DaRT 8.0.
segment.target: For information about how to resolve this issue, see Troubleshooting DaRT 8.0.

segment.source: If any of the registry hives are corrupted or missing, Registry Editor and several other DaRT utilities will have limited functionality.
segment.target: If any of the registry hives are corrupted or missing, Registry Editor and several other DaRT utilities will have limited functionality.

segment.source: If no operating system is selected, some tools will not be available.
segment.target: If no operating system is selected, some tools will not be available.

segment.source: The System Recovery Options window appears and lists various recovery tools.
segment.target: The System Recovery Options window appears and lists various recovery tools.

segment.source: On the System Recovery Options window, click Microsoft Diagnostics and Recovery Toolset to open the Diagnostics and Recovery Toolset.
segment.target: On the System Recovery Options window, click Microsoft Diagnostics and Recovery Toolset to open the Diagnostics and Recovery Toolset.

segment.source: On the Diagnostics and Recovery Toolset window, click Remote Connection to open the DaRT Remote Connection window.
segment.target: On the Diagnostics and Recovery Toolset window, click Remote Connection to open the DaRT Remote Connection window.

segment.source: If you are prompted to give the help desk remote access, click OK.
segment.target: If you are prompted to give the help desk remote access, click OK.

segment.source: The DaRT Remote Connection window opens and displays a ticket number, IP address, and port information.
segment.target: The DaRT Remote Connection window opens and displays a ticket number, IP address, and port information.

segment.source: On the help desk computer, open the DaRT Remote Connection Viewer.
segment.target: On the help desk computer, open the DaRT Remote Connection Viewer.

segment.source: Click Start, click All Programs, click Microsoft DaRT 8.0, and then click DaRT Remote Connection Viewer.
segment.target: Click Start, click All Programs, click Microsoft DaRT 8.0, and then click DaRT Remote Connection Viewer.

segment.source: In the DaRT Remote Connection window, enter the required ticket, IP address, and port information.
segment.target: In the DaRT Remote Connection window, enter the required ticket, IP address, and port information.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: This information is created on the end-user computer and must be provided by the end user.
segment.target: This information is created on the end-user computer and must be provided by the end user.

segment.source: There might be multiple IP addresses to choose from, depending on how many are available on the end-user computer.
segment.target: There might be multiple IP addresses to choose from, depending on how many are available on the end-user computer.

segment.source: Click Connect.
segment.target: Click Connect.

segment.source: The IT administrator now assumes control of the end-user computer and can run the DaRT tools remotely.
segment.target: The IT administrator now assumes control of the end-user computer and can run the DaRT tools remotely.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: A file is provided that is named inv32.xml and contains remote connection information, such as the port number and IP address.
segment.target: A file is provided that is named inv32.xml and contains remote connection information, such as the port number and IP address.

segment.source: By default, the file is typically located at %windir%system32.
segment.target: By default, the file is typically located at %windir%system32.

segment.source: To customize the Remote Connection process
segment.target: To customize the Remote Connection process

segment.source: You can customize the Remote Connection process by editing the winpeshl.ini file.
segment.target: You can customize the Remote Connection process by editing the winpeshl.ini file.

segment.source: For more information about how to edit the winpeshl.ini file, see Winpeshl.ini Files.
segment.target: For more information about how to edit the winpeshl.ini file, see Winpeshl.ini Files.

segment.source: Specify the following commands and parameters to customize how a remote connection is established with an end-user computer:
segment.target: Specify the following commands and parameters to customize how a remote connection is established with an end-user computer:

segment.source: Command
segment.target: Command

segment.source: Parameter
segment.target: Parameter

segment.source: Description
segment.target: Description

segment.source: RemoteRecovery.exe
segment.target: RemoteRecovery.exe

segment.source: -nomessage
segment.target: -nomessage

segment.source: Specifies that the confirmation prompt is not displayed.
segment.target: Specifies that the confirmation prompt is not displayed.

segment.source: Remote Connection continues just as if the end user had responded Yes to the confirmation prompt.
segment.target: Remote Connection continues just as if the end user had responded Yes to the confirmation prompt.

segment.source: WaitForConnection.exe
segment.target: WaitForConnection.exe

segment.source: none
segment.target: none

segment.source: Prevents a custom script from continuing until either Remote Connection is not running or a valid connection is established with the end-user computer.
segment.target: Prevents a custom script from continuing until either Remote Connection is not running or a valid connection is established with the end-user computer.

segment.source: Important
segment.target: Important

segment.source: This command serves no function if it is specified independently.
segment.target: This command serves no function if it is specified independently.

segment.source: It must be specified in a script to function correctly.
segment.target: It must be specified in a script to function correctly.

segment.source: The following is an example of a winpeshl.ini file that is customized to open the Remote Connection tool as soon as an attempt is made to boot into DaRT:
segment.target: The following is an example of a winpeshl.ini file that is customized to open the Remote Connection tool as soon as an attempt is made to boot into DaRT:

segment.source: When DaRT starts, it creates the file inv32.xml in WindowsSystem32 on the RAM disk.
segment.target: When DaRT starts, it creates the file inv32.xml in WindowsSystem32 on the RAM disk.

segment.source: This file contains connection information: IP address, port, and ticket number.
segment.target: This file contains connection information: IP address, port, and ticket number.

segment.source: You can copy this file to a network share to trigger a Help desk workflow.
segment.target: You can copy this file to a network share to trigger a Help desk workflow.

segment.source: For example, a custom program can check the network share for connection files, and then create a support ticket or send email notifications.
segment.target: For example, a custom program can check the network share for connection files, and then create a support ticket or send email notifications.

segment.source: To run the Remote Connection Viewer at the command prompt
segment.target: To run the Remote Connection Viewer at the command prompt

segment.source: To run the DaRT Remote Connection Viewer at the command prompt, specify the DartRemoteViewer.exe command and use the following parameters:
segment.target: To run the DaRT Remote Connection Viewer at the command prompt, specify the DartRemoteViewer.exe command and use the following parameters:

segment.source: Parameter
segment.target: Parameter

segment.source: Description
segment.target: Description

segment.source: -ticket=ticketnumber
segment.target: -ticket=ticketnumber

segment.source: Where ticketnumber is the ticket number, including the dashes, that is generated by Remote Connection.
segment.target: Where ticketnumber is the ticket number, including the dashes, that is generated by Remote Connection.

segment.source: -ipaddress=ipaddress
segment.target: -ipaddress=ipaddress

segment.source: Where ipaddress is the IP address that is generated by Remote Connection.
segment.target: Where ipaddress is the IP address that is generated by Remote Connection.

segment.source: -port=port
segment.target: -port=port

segment.source: Where port is the port that corresponds to the specified IP address.
segment.target: Where port is the port that corresponds to the specified IP address.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: The variables for these parameters are created on the end-user computer and must be provided by the end user.
segment.target: The variables for these parameters are created on the end-user computer and must be provided by the end user.

segment.source: If all three parameters are specified and the data is valid, a connection is immediately tried when the program starts.
segment.target: If all three parameters are specified and the data is valid, a connection is immediately tried when the program starts.

segment.source: If any parameter is not valid, the program starts as if there were no parameters specified.
segment.target: If any parameter is not valid, the program starts as if there were no parameters specified.

segment.source: Related topics
segment.target: Related topics

segment.target: Operations for DaRT 8.0

segment.target: Recovering Computers Using DaRT 8.0
